meanings.definition: A title of respect used before a man's name in formal correspondence.
meanings.sent1: The esquire greeted the guests at the event.
meanings.sent2: Please address the letter to Mr. Smith, esquire.
meanings.sent3: The esquire in the fancy suit tripped over his own shoelaces.
meanings.sent4: The young boy proudly declared himself an esquire of the playground.
meanings.sent5: The title of esquire added an air of sophistication to his name.

meanings.definition: A member of the English gentry ranking just below a knight.
meanings.sent1: The esquire assisted the knight in preparing for battle.
meanings.sent2: In medieval times, an esquire served as a knight's apprentice.
meanings.sent3: The esquire's horse refused to move, causing a comical delay.
meanings.sent4: He felt like an esquire in shining armor, ready to protect his friends.
meanings.sent5: The esquire's loyalty to his lord was unwavering and true.

meanings.sent1: The esquire presented a compelling case in court.
meanings.sent2: An esquire is knowledgeable in matters of law and justice.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy esquire accidentally spilled coffee on the judge's robe.
meanings.sent4: She fought for justice like a fearless esquire in a legal battlefield.
meanings.sent5: The esquire's sharp mind and quick wit won the case for his client.
